cyclone.name: IAN
cyclone.current_location: about 345 miles SSE of Grand Cayman
cyclone.trajectory: forecast to turn northwest today, then north-northwest Monday and north on Tuesday – tracking across western Cuba into the east-central Gulf, then bending north-northeast toward the Florida peninsula mid-week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: west–central Florida coast (near the Tampa Bay area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None issued for Florida as of Advisory #9
weather_observation.warning_coast: None issued for Florida as of Advisory #9
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Keys, west and central Florida peninsula, and portions of the east-central Florida coast including Canaveral
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–57 mph) are possible at Canaveral mid-week with a peak 33 % chance around early Thursday; risk of sustained 50-kt winds remains low (≈7 %).
weather_observation.storm_surge: No significant storm-surge inundation expected on the Atlantic side of Florida under the current forecast track.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain could bring 2–4 inches with localized amounts above 4 inches Wednesday–Thursday, potentially causing brief urban or low-lying flooding near the port.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents will develop along the east-central Florida Atlantic beaches beginning mid-week.
